广告牌 https://www.billboard.com音乐排行榜、新闻、照片和视频2023 年 10 月 20 日星期五 14:10:44 +0000 en-US每小时1 https://wordpress.org/?v=6.2.3 鲁保罗如何通过新专辑“Essential Christmas”拥抱“文化策展人”的角色https://www.billboard.com/culture/pride/rupaul-essential-christmas-album-drag-race-interview-1235448963/ Fri, 20 Oct 2023 14:00:00 +0000 CulturePridechristmasinterviewpriderupauls drag race https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235448963 The drag icon chats with Billboard 介绍了他的新专辑的制作过程、流媒体如何改变了他的音乐生涯、变装皇后秀的遗产等等。 ;

可以肯定地说，鲁保罗·查尔斯是目前在该行业最忙碌的名人之一。除了主持并执行制作荣获艾美奖的真人秀节目《鲁保罗变装皇后秀》外，这位变装偶像在 2023 年还负责监督该节目不断增多的国际衍生剧、主持自己的游戏节目并写了一本书。

现在，鲁保罗透露了他不断增加的清单上的另一个项目。周五（10 月 20 日），这位明星推出了《Essential Christmas》 ，这是他全新的节日专辑，收录了他过去三个圣诞项目中个人最喜欢的歌曲，同时也让粉丝们尝到了 doo-wop jam 歌曲《Baby Doll》中的新内容。这是为假日季节量身定制的。

当与《公告牌》谈论他的新项目时，就连鲁保罗也对他在发行圣诞歌曲方面多产的职业生涯感到惊讶。 “我从来没有打算发行任何圣诞节唱片，但不知怎的，事情就这样发生了，”他说。 “我真的很喜欢它。”

下面，鲁保罗与Billboard讨论了他最新专辑的制作过程、他最喜欢的圣诞节回忆、他的揭露性新回忆录《隐藏意义之屋》的写作演变，以及变装皇后秀的持续遗产。

有关的

鲁保罗宣布他即将出版的回忆录让他“被堵住、被堵住、被剥光……”

2023年10月20日

《Essential Christmas》是你的第四张圣诞专辑，也是你今年推出的第二张专辑，还有你目前正在从事的其他职业。您如何抽出时间来整合这些项目？

好吧，此时我真正要做的就是工作。 [笑]我真的很喜欢工作。所以我工作很多——我通常不喜欢坐着，只是闲逛。

让我们首先谈谈这张专辑的新单曲“Baby Doll”。我喜欢你在这里所采用的 50 年代 doo-wop 风格。你和 Freddie 是如何构思这首歌曲的？

嗯，Freddie 和我都喜欢 50 年代的 doo-wop。当我想到圣诞音乐时，我认为那个时代确实是圣诞节的声音，尤其是充满舞蹈、有趣的圣诞节。所以我们从这里开始，然后看了一些当前的歌曲——嗯，至少在过去 15 年里——它们都有同样的 50 年代节奏。就在那时，我们听到了碧昂丝的《单身女士》。所以鼓的模式类似于“Single Ladies”，但它具有 50 年代 doo-wop 风格的所有元素。

专辑的其余部分大部分都是对过去圣诞歌曲进行重新制作的最热门歌曲风格的合辑——你是如何挑选出哪些歌曲将被剪辑，哪些歌曲不会被剪辑的？

嗯，在流媒体时代，一切都与策划有关——不仅仅是音乐，还包括生活中的一切。人们有如此多的选择，因此我的工作在某种程度上成为了文化策展人。因此，由于流媒体，我想我应该把我创作过的所有最重要的歌曲放在一个地方，这样可以让人们更容易理解。而且，我也喜欢快乐、有趣、有舞蹈的圣诞派对。当我们第一次开始制作《娃娃》时，它最初是有点黑暗和忧郁的。尽管那很美，但在我们做了一个演示之后，我说，“你知道吗，让我们改变这一点，让我们让它更快乐。”所以我们最终放弃了它的第一次演绎，我们唯一保留的原始歌曲就是标题。

无论如何，我对这一切的看法是我喜欢圣诞快乐；我时不时地喜欢一首忧郁的圣诞歌曲，我只是不想在这个系列中使用它。

这是您提出的一个有趣的大观点——流媒体时代从根本上改变了我们消费音乐的方式，而且您一直非常有意识地跟上音乐的新发展。整个行业焦点的转变如何改变了你的音乐生涯？

是的，发生了很多变化，我已经适应了这些变化。这其中存在挑战，而我喜欢挑战。这就像一个谜题，你要思考消费者想要什么，然后在不影响你的艺术视野的情况下进行调整。我喜欢这样一个事实：一切都对每个人来说都是可用的。

那么问题就变成了——对于电影、时尚和各种形式的艺术来说都是如此——你需要一位邮轮总监会说，“这里很重要，去这里吧。”就我而言，我在这个星球上已经有一段时间了，我见证了流行音乐的历史、电影的历史以及所有这些事情。因此，我的工作就是将这一点传递下去，为几十年前不在这里的人们提供指导和策划，让他们说：“嘿，就在那里，这真的很重要。”

这就是为什么我真正欣赏采样如何成为现代流行音乐的主要内容的部分原因，因为它让新一代能够理解他们可能不曾了解的旧参考。

是的，没错，只要他们理解上下文，只要他们了解完整的故事。当我还是个孩子的时候，有四个电视频道，我会看迈克·道格拉斯和约翰尼·卡森这样的脱口秀节目。在观看这些节目时，我充满了在我出生之前发生的事情。我开始了解艾拉·菲茨杰拉德、莎拉·沃恩和乔·威廉姆斯是谁。这些脱口秀节目最终为我展示了我因不在场而错过的东西。

圣诞节专辑本身的概念已经成为许多艺术家在过去几十年中融入其曲目的主要内容——您认为节日音乐的哪些因素能够引起观众如此强烈的共鸣？

我认为人们想要唤起童年的怀旧和回忆或欢乐的回忆。世界上有如此多的黑暗，但我们却得到了一扇充满欢乐、幸福、色彩、灯光、爱、赠送礼物和幸福的小窗。我想每个人都想从中分一杯羹——我知道我是这么做的。我从未打算发行任何圣诞节唱片。但不知怎的，事情就是这样发生的。我真的很喜欢它。

当你听到圣诞歌曲时，你是否有强烈的圣诞记忆？

嗯，我有过去 30 年的圣诞节记忆——在我的童年，我们没有任何记忆，因为我们没有钱，这非常悲伤。但你知道，当我遇到乔治（勒巴尔，鲁保罗的丈夫）时，事情发生了变化，因为他热爱圣诞节。我们在一起的事实让我们想要庆祝一下。当你的生活中有爱，并且有值得庆祝的事情时，它就会变成一件快乐的事情。所以这30年来，我很喜欢圣诞节。我们期待着它，因为我们要么可以在家举办一场盛大的圣诞节庆祝活动，要么可以去一些美妙的地方旅行。现在，圣诞节对我来说很可爱，所以我喜欢通过我的圣诞音乐传递这种快乐。

有关的

鲁斯卡尔的历史：一次性“变装皇后秀”挑战如何成为……

2023年10月20日

我还想谈谈您即将出版的回忆录《隐藏意义之屋》 。在你的声明中，你非常明确地表示，这本书将看到你最脆弱的时候——作为一个建立了受欢迎的形象来保护你的私生活的人，在写这本书的过程中解构这个形象是一种什么样的体验？

这并不容易，因为在公共场合生活时，你必须非常非常小心。但是，为了写我想做的回忆录，我必须完全开放并自由地表达自己。当然，现在，在它写在纸上之后，我可以收回并缓和我所说的一些更严厉的内容。但这是非常宣泄的，因为我必须回到犯罪现场，并庆祝我在我的生活中，而不仅仅是在我的职业生涯中是多么幸运。

我之所以能够完成所有这些工作，部分原因在于奋力向前，而不是因为过去的轻率行为而放慢脚步。我继续前进，同时处理很多项目；写这本书的过程让我能够放慢脚步，翻阅我生活的购物篮，挖掘这些旧的记忆。

这也必须是一个非常治愈的过程，才能让你的生活回到那样的状态。

这是！我们大多数人都试图压制其中一些记忆，但在这些记忆中蕴藏着如此多的希望、力量和勇气。当你能穿过火海，当你能做这样的盘点时，你就能让自己前进，你就能减轻一些包袱。例如，作为一个孩子，很多时候我们认为我们的父母因为我们小时候所做的事情而吵架——但作为一个成年人，你可以回顾过去并说，‘哦，实际上那与我无关。 '

《变装皇后秀》的发展令人欣喜——27 次荣获艾美奖，多个衍生剧，十多个国际版本，数百个变装皇后的职业生涯开始了。你是否经常发现自己在思考你的遗产和这个节目的遗产？

我在写这本书的时候当然也在思考这个问题，因为这本书让我能够反思。但通常情况下，我会尝试活在当下，处理好自己必须做的事情，才能度过今天。总是想着这些太分散注意力了，你真的无法前进。

作为该节目的超级粉丝和流行音乐迷，我一直想问你如何选择对口型同步的歌曲，因为该节目在融合流派、时代方面做得非常出色和共鸣。

我的意思是，我在夜总会的舞台上工作了 30 多年，所以当我听到一首对口型歌曲时，我就知道一首好听的歌曲。并非所有歌曲都是口型同步歌曲。但电视节目的标准是找到女王可以演唱的歌曲。事实上，这是唯一的标准。

该剧在过去 15 年里经历了如此多的演变，常常给人一种变装的感觉 种族有指数增长的空间。有没有什么是你在节目中没能实现但希望在未来几年实现的？

好吧，它确实不在我手中。该剧的新鲜之处在于，每一季都会有这些出色、勇敢的艺术家前来与我们和世界分享他们的故事。作为制作人，我们会尽我们所能来创建基础设施，但来自参赛者的新鲜血液和能量才是节目的本质。

; 乔丹·戴维斯 (Jordan Davis) 将大部分出版目录出售给 Anthem Entertainment https://www.billboard.com/pro/jordan-davis-sells-publishing-catalog-anthem-entertainment/ Fri, 20 Oct 2023 14:00:00 +0000 BusinessPublishingAnthem Entertainmentcatalog sales https://www.billboard.com/?post_type=billboard_pro_post&p=1235449768 The deal includes such hits as "Buy Dirt," "What My World Spins Around" and "Next Thing You Know."

冉冉升起的乡村明星乔丹·戴维斯 (Jordan Davis)已将其出版目录的大部分股份出售给 Anthem Entertainment，从而扩大了他与这家多伦多公司的关系。

虽然艺术家在职业生涯的早期阶段做出这样的举动相对罕见，但戴维斯正在利用这些资金投资他的未来。

“对我们来说，最重要的事情之一就是创造一点灵活性，以便能够在考虑预算的情况下做出一些长期决策，”戴维斯的经理、红灯公司的扎克·萨顿 ( Zach Sutton)说道。二月，戴维斯将进行他的首次欧洲巡演，包括斯德哥尔摩、阿姆斯特丹和伦敦。虽然萨顿表示音乐会已经几乎售罄，但“它们并不是最有利可图的日期，从这次销售中获得一些资源使我们能够更加战略性地思考长期建设，而不仅仅是‘如果我们致力于第一季度’”到了欧洲，我们在美国真的会错过这种钱。”

有关的

Anthem 扩大 Timbaland 出版交易，投资制作人的 Beatclub 市场

2023年10月20日

戴维斯周围的兴奋也影响了时机。自从戴维斯的第一张专辑《Singles You Up》在 2017 年登上 Billboard 乡村音乐播放榜第一名以来，戴维斯一直是一位非常可靠的热门歌曲制作者。从那时起，每一个官方电台发行的歌曲都进入了前 5 名，另外三首歌曲包括 2019 年的《Slow》 《Dance in the Parking Lot》、2021 年的《Buy Dirt》（由Luke Bryan主演）和 2022 年的《What My World Spins around》达到顶峰。戴维斯与弟弟雅各布以及另一对兄弟乔什·詹金斯和马特·詹金斯共同创作的《Buy Dirt》去年获得了 CMA 年度歌曲奖。今年的《Next Thing You Know》在乡村音乐播放排行榜上最高排名第二，并将在下个月的 2023 年 CMA 颁奖典礼上角逐同一奖项。除了创作自己的素材外，戴维斯还获得了杰克·欧文 (Jake Owen)和Old Dominion的歌曲剪辑。 Sutton 说，他的总流量已超过 60 亿。

“乔丹目前的热度、市场、[Anthem]所涉及的新团队，都表明这是一个好时机，可以从牌桌上拿走一些筹码，但要让[乔丹]留在比赛中，并继续在同时，”萨顿继续说道。

新团队包括贾森·克莱因 (Jason Klein)和萨尔·法扎里 (Sal Fazzari) ，他们在前首席执行官海伦·墨菲 ( Helen Murphy) 2 月份离职后担任临时首席执行官，并于本月早些时候分别被任命为 永久首席执行官和首席财务官。两人都曾在 Anthem 担任过其他职务。 Gilles Godard自 2006 年起加入该公司，担任 Anthem 位于纳什维尔的音乐出版业务总裁。

“乔丹对我们来说特别重要。我们显然认为他是一名出色的作家和表演者，但乔丹的真正特别之处在于我们从一开始就一直在那里，”克莱因说，他指的是戈达尔在 2015 年作为一名新生作家签下戴维斯。 “作为一名独立出版商，[他]在他的整个创作过程中一直是他的合作伙伴，这对我们来说非常重要，现在他正处于职业生涯的这个阶段，我们能够坚持并继续提供超级服务他作为出版商。此时他有很多选择，留在主队，这很大程度上说明了他对我们在纳什维尔所做的事情以及我们拥有的伟大团队的信念。”

有关的

老鹰队的乔·沃尔什 (Joe Walsh) 与 Reservoir 签署出版协议

2023年10月20日

“Anthem 团队对我来说已经发展成为一个伟大的创意平台，”戴维斯在一份声明中说道。 “他们对我作为一名艺术家和词曲作者的信任——从我第一次搬到纳什维尔作为词曲作者到现在，这一路走来影响很大。”

除了获得戴维斯目录的权益之外，《Anthem》交易还扩展了该公司与戴维斯现有的联合出版协议。 “我们很自豪地说，乔丹八年前在《圣歌》中开始了他的出版生涯，努力工作确实有回报，现在在接下来的八年里与乔丹·戴维斯一起创造更多的音乐历史，”戈达尔补充道。

纳什维尔律师事务所 Loeb and Loeb 的Derek Crownover 、 John Rolfe和Colleen Kelley在本次交易中代表戴维斯。

正如 Fazzari 指出的那样，Anthem 购买了其他国家出版目录的一部分，包括 Jody Williams Music、Better Angels、RED Creative Group 和 Red Vinyl（其中包括Chris Janson的目录）。 “纳什维尔一直是我们的焦点，不仅是创意的焦点，也是目录的焦点，因为我们都喜欢音乐和小镇。我们收到的歌曲非常永恒。我们已经积累了相当可观的目录。”

Anthem 还购买了纳什维尔的部分单曲，包括联合编剧 Jesse Rice 的 2012 年佛罗里达乔治亚线热门歌曲《Cruise》。 （其出版交易远远超出了国家范围，包括与Timbaland建立了长期合作伙伴关系，Anthem 于 2012 年收购了 Timbaland 的目录。Anthem 继续投资新的 Timbaland 企业。）

虽然戴维斯的交易是克莱因和法扎里上任以来完成的第一笔实质性目录购买，但“我们正在考虑很多事情，”克莱因说。 “我们正在探索相当强大的机会渠道。我们预计未来几个月将会非常忙碌。”

Fazzari 补充道，Anthem 的渠道正在探索补充现有出版合作伙伴并帮助多元化进入其他领域的交易，但“我们不会追求通常伴随拍卖过程的大型或高价目录。我们喜欢花大量时间投资于我们网络内的关系，这为我们带来了交易流。”

; 值得关注的经理人：帮助诺亚·卡汉、冰香料、扎克·布莱恩等的新晋高管https://www.billboard.com/business/management/music-managers-to-watch-noah-kahan-ice-spice-zach-bryan-1235449477/ Fri, 20 Oct 2023 13:57:26 +0000 BusinessManagementmagazinemanagementManagersmanagers to watch https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235449477 These managers and management teams on the rise reveal what it takes to successfully guide new talent through a breakout year.

这些冉冉升起的经纪人带领他们的艺人度过了突破岁月，开创了诸如登上排行榜榜首、为泰勒·斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）举办体育场演出，甚至自己的演出门票全部售罄等首创。

德鲁·西蒙斯

年龄： 41
公司：基础音乐
主要客户： Noah Kahan、Dayglow、COIN

“不再有非周期了，”西蒙斯说，他曾坐在前排观看了诺亚·卡汉不间断的一年，“这对艺术家周围的基础设施造成了负担，也对艺术家本身造成了负担。”从卡汉凭借《Stick Season》及其豪华版（后者首次亮相就在Billboard 200排行榜上排名第 3）取得成功，到场馆门票全部售罄，再到通过 The Busyhead Project 筹集近 200 万美元用于心理健康资源，西蒙斯“对艺术家未来的机会感到兴奋”随着范式的转变，他们手中的筹码越来越多。”

小詹姆斯·罗斯蒙德

年龄： 31
公司：策划艺术家
主要客户： Ice Spice、RIOTUSA

Ice Spice 成为今年排行榜上的主打歌曲，在Hot 100排行榜上有四首歌曲进入前 10 名，其中包括与泰勒·斯威夫特 (Taylor Swift) 和妮琪·米娜 (Nicki Minaj) 等超级巨星的合作。对于 Rosemond 来说，能够在其中两首歌曲（《戴安娜王妃》和《芭比世界》）中与 Ice 和制作人 RIOTUSA 以及 Minaj 搭档，尤其令人欣慰：“我非常乐于帮助创意人士实现梦想并积极改变他们的社会经济地位。 ”

杰西·加松戈-亚历山大，菲比·戈尔德

年龄： 30、29
公司：近邻

; 从人工智能到虚拟现实，这些是音乐未来科技的顶级投资者https://www.billboard.com/business/tech/music-tech-investors-ai-vr-list-1235447833/ Fri, 20 Oct 2023 13:57:13 +0000 BusinessTechAIinvestmentmagazinetech https://www.billboard.com/?p=1235447833 The major labels, angel investors, venture capital execs and more that are putting their money behind the innovative ideas that could move the music industry forward.

无论是为初创公司提供数万美元的天使投资者，还是为初创公司提供数亿美元的风险投资巨头，音乐行业及其周围的一些最精明的人都在利用他们的专业知识对未来的工具进行再投资。这里介绍的投资者只是目前关注新音乐技术的众多投资者中的一小部分；他们的一些同行更愿意将交易保密，而更多的音乐高管转型为投资者，将赌注押在音乐技术以外的领域。其他人对音乐技术感兴趣，但没有积极投资。但随着生成人工智能、虚拟现实和现场音乐技术的进步即将到来，这里强调的思想领袖认为该行业正处于一个“临界点”——下一代公司可能会从根本上改变音乐业务的运作方式。

人工智能已经改变音乐产业的 5 种方式

2023年10月20日

专业

三大音乐集团已经投资了与时尚、游戏、音乐创作甚至抗击痴呆症相关的技术平台——高管们表示还会有更多投资。

今年 2 月，在担任华纳音乐集团 (WMG) 新任首席执行官后的首次季度财报电话会议上，罗伯特·金克尔 (Robert Kyncl) 阐述了音乐行业“有意义的上升空间”的未来：“随着技术开放新兴经济体，该行业的潜在市场将继续进一步扩张，”Kyncl 告诉分析师。最重要的是，他补充道，“创新不断创造新的音乐用例，让我们有机会实现收入来源多元化。”

As the major labels navigate a landscape increasingly dominated by streaming platforms and digital creation apps like BandLab and Boomy, it's not surprising they have eagerly invested over $1 billion, according to label sources, in the nascent technology companies that have the potential to help them diversify and increase their revenue sources.

In the last four years, WMG has invested in gaming platform Roblox, digital fashion retailer DRESSX and music generator Lifescore, which is powered by artificial intelligence (AI). Sony Music Entertainment has backed another music creation (and collaboration) platform, Tully; social platform Fave; and Techstars Music, an accelerator program that provided funding and mentorship to promising music technology startups. (It was quietly shuttered after this summer's class, according to managing director Bob Moczydlowsky.)

“It is always a highlight for us to support visionary entrepreneurs in developing innovative music tech and to help drive experimentation with new products and revenue models that enhance creativity, consumer experiences and overall value and utility for our creative partners and artists,” SME senior vp of strategy and investments Angela Lopes says.

Universal Music Group eschews venture capital investments, preferring to offer seed money, mentoring and other support for startups. The company has gotten behind two health-related music apps: Endel, which creates personalized AI-generated soundscapes to foster focus and sleep, and Music Health, the company behind Vera, which is designed to help those suffering from dementia, as well as next-generation radio broadcasting toolkit Super-HiFi. UMG senior vp of digital innovation strategy and business development Kristen Bender said in a statement that the company's “music DNA — incubation, connectivity, mentorship [and] strategic partner network — is the greatest asset we can provide early-stage companies.”

It's likely that the volume of these investments will only increase. Lopes says, “We continue to focus on strategic investment opportunities” in the tech sector. And on the earnings call, Kyncl said WMG will be “reallocating our internal resources in order to invest in technology and drive not only more tools for monetization for creators but also greater efficiencies for us.” —ELIAS LEIGHT

Music Companies

Willard Ahdritz
Founder/chairman, Kobalt; CEO, Ahdritz & Co.

Recent investments: Dice, un:hurd
Interests: Mobile ticketing, data-driven marketing

As founder and chairman of Kobalt — a publishing administration company that used a technology-first approach to disrupt the world of music publishing — Ahdritz has always had a forward-thinking approach to the music business. In recent years, he has been investing in other newcomers using technology to power music innovation, including popular mobile ticketing app Dice, and he has taken on an investment and advisory role in un:hurd, which uses data to help artists run successful digital marketing campaigns.

Mike Caren
Founder/CEO, Artist Partner Group/Artist Publishing Group

Recent investments: beatBread, Sound.me, Release.Global
Interests: AI, music production tools, label tools

The label/publishing entrepreneur entered investing by acquiring music catalogs, but in recent years has expanded his focus to music technology and related startups. He says various forms of music tech are worthwhile “for both financial growth and for the good of the industry.” Caren hopes that the new companies he backs can “unleash creativity for those with huge imagination and limited knowledge” as well as economic and relationship-based limitations. But whether these results come through AI, augmented reality, traditional or currently unheard-of means “is less important for me.”

Startup red flag: “I try to avoid great decks without functioning software. I want to invest in companies with a minimum viable product I can use immediately and a clear road map for their future development.”

Neil Jacobson
Founder/CEO, Hallwood Media; partner, Hallwood Media Ventures

Recent investments: Disco, Splice, Soundful
Interests: AI, music production tools, creator services, marketplace platforms

Jacobson, former president of Geffen Records and founder of songwriter-producer management powerhouse Hallwood Media, brings decades of experience at labels and publishers to investing. Hallwood Media Ventures was born out of a special purpose acquisition company Jacobson launched in February 2021 with partner Todd Lowen, raising $230 million for a publicly listed vehicle with the intent of merging with a high-growth, music-related business. Now, almost three years later, Hallwood is unencumbered by the restrictions of a SPAC and looking to invest “in the range of $25 million for minority stakes, up to $250 million for larger stakes or full takeouts,” says Jacobson, who adds that though the firm is seeking companies throughout the music sector, “music technology seems to be where we are spending a lot of our time.” Still, as technology evolves, Jacobson envisions that great managers, like those on staff at Hallwood, will be “more critical than ever. The world, especially music, is changing at a pace we've never seen before. The need for management teams to react quickly and intelligently will only be amplified.”

Words an investor should live by: “ 'Show me the money!' We say that half-jokingly, but companies need to demonstrate the ability to generate EBITDA [earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization] … We look for businesses that are executing on a responsible plan that is ready to be scaled with our help — both financially and strategically.”

Nick Jarjour
Founder/CEO, JarjourCo

Recent investments: Soundful, mayk.it, HIFI, Xposure, Triller
Interests: Music and gaming, livestreaming, virtual concerts, AI, virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), fintech

Jarjour, an entrepreneur and manager for songwriter Starrah, says his first mentor told him: “Don't just invest in companies. Advise them, consult them, sit on their boards.” So when he provides funding to a startup, he often assumes an advisory role too, as he did with mayk.it, HIFI, Xposure and more. He likens the role of an investor in a fledgling company to A&R, where his career began, and he aims to spot “hit companies” much as he would a song.

In the next five years, music tech will…: “See more artists and celebrity investors, more music and gaming partnerships, more growth in VR/AR music experiences … [There will be] a digital transformation for labels, funds and publishers propelled by breakthroughs like AI and the democratization of things.”

Andrew Kahn
Head of Crush Ventures

Investments: Splice, Audioshake, Sound.xyz, CreateSafe, Rhythm.fm
Interests: Fan technology, music production tools, creator tools

Alongside colleagues Aaron Matusow and Dan Kruchkow, Kahn leads the venture capital division for longtime independent management company Crush Music. With Crush Ventures, Kahn and his team make investment decisions that align with the overall company ethos: “We look to invest in building companies that could impact how we manage and grow the careers of Crush Music artists, who are also pop-culture brands,” Kahn says. That's why the team is so interested in working with companies that create tools empowering artists, like Splice, Audioshake and CreateSafe. In the next five years, Kahn says he sees these companies “narrowing the gap between novice and pro.”

Startup red flags: “We try to avoid founders who are not living the culture of the market they are trying to enter or feeling the pain acutely of the problem they are trying to solve. Other nits are requests to sign [nondisclosure agreements] too quickly and early-stage companies using agencies to build core products.”

Naoki Osada
CEO, Avex USA; founder, Future of Music Fund

Recent investments: Wave, Endel, Liminal Space, Strangeloop Studios
Interests: Metaverse, 3D, live experiences, virtual artists, music production tools

When he's not running label and publishing operations at Avex USA, the thriving American outpost of the Japanese entertainment company, Osada is vetting emerging companies to invest in through Avex USA's corporate venture capital division. Called the Future of Music Fund, Osada says he invests “in a selective, boutique way” in companies he feels build “immersive multisensory experiences of music” — like Endel's personalized soundscapes that promote relaxation and Wave's high-tech virtual concert production tools. So far, the fund has invested about $5 million and has now expanded to $25 million “based on the past successes.” Still, Osada notes that due to saturation in the market, he doesn't “see quite as many mind-blowing early-stage companies these days as five years ago.”

Words an investor should live by: “In general, [our] motto is 'innovate or die.' We must constantly become different for the better in aspects of business/life to survive.”

 Angel investor; vp of music intelligence, SoundCloud

This week, I guess this is Blink-182 growing up, Charli XCX and Sam Smith have a night on the town and The Rolling Stones triumphantly return to the studio. Check out all of this week's picks below:

Blink-182, One More Time…

“Aging gracefully” was never the logical outcome for Blink-182, a trio of pop-punk geniuses who built their live shows around scatological humor and turned their album titles into dirty jokes. Yet harrowing life experiences, particularly Mark Hoppus' 2021 battle with cancer, has provided Blink-182 with a newfound sense of appreciation, and One More Time…, the first album with their classic lineup since 2011, carries a feeling of gravitas that acknowledges how much Hoppus, Tom DeLonge and Travis Barker care about each other in middle age. That doesn't make One More Time… a dour affair, though: from early single “Edging” to pummeling opener “Anthem Part 3” to the radio-ready “Dance With Me,” Blink-182 have figured out a way to fire off more chewy melodies in between the heartfelt moments.

Charli XCX & Sam Smith, “In The City”

“The song is about finding the people you truly love and connect with through wild nights out and partying in magical places,” Charli XCX says in a press release of her charming new one-off with Sam Smith, “In The City.” A decade after getting the party started with songs like “Take My Hand” and the Icona Pop smash “I Love It,” Charli offers a more reflective night out (“I never thought I would find it / But I found what I was lookin' for,” she sings), while Smith's soulful vocals and the blinking synths bolster the song, giving “In The City” the feeling of starry-eyed connection at the heart of the collaboration.

The Kid LAROI, Jung Kook & Central Cee, “Too Much”

Jung Kook and The Kid LAROI both know their ways around a durable pop hit, while songs like “Sprinter” and “Let Go” have established British rapper Central Cee as a chart heavyweight overseas; with their powers combined, the three have cooked up a downcast, undeniably catchy collaboration that sounds primed to become ubiquitous as the weather turns colder. “Too Much” showcases another rock-solid Jung Kook hook following “Seven” and “3D,” as well as a hardened middle verse from Central Cee, but LAROI sounds reinvigorated on the track, hoisting up rhymes and melodies with an ease that recalls his Justin Bieber-assisted smash “Stay.”

The Rolling Stones, Hackney Diamonds

What should a new Rolling Stones album sound like in 2023? The legends' first full-length of new material since 2005's A Bigger Bang was years in the making, and arrives without an ounce of anything left to prove — and that lack of expectation works in its favor, as Mick, Keith and Ronnie have cooked up a rollicking check-in that should translate nicely to the stadium stage. A mix of iconic guests (Paul McCartney, Elton John and Lady Gaga all swing by) and meat-and-potatoes rock grooves (“Mess It Up” and “Whole Wide World” are a pair of mid-album highlights) help situate Hackney Diamonds as a best-case scenario for a band in their hallowed position.

21 Savage feat. d4vd, “Call Me Revenge”

The fact that “Call Me Revenge,” the new team-up between 21 Savage and d4vd, was launched in conjunction with the upcoming release of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III helps explain the lyrical slant — after all, it's easier to unpack d4vd crooning “I'm here to collect to all your sins, I'm goin' in!” within the context of a first-person shooter game. Still, “Call Me Revenge” allows both artists to have fun while striking their most menacing poses, especially 21 Savage, who sounds downright jubilant while firing off clipped boasts and endless ad-libs.

Editor's Pick: Jane Remover, Census Designated

You won't hear another album like Census Designated , the sophomore effort by Jane Remover, this year, or most years: the singer-producer, who reconfigured her sound (as well as came out as a trans woman) following 2021 debut Frailty , has mastered a singular blend of shoegaze, noise rock, pop melodies and indie balladry across these 10 tracks, while also prodding at her personal evolution and identity. Parts of Census Designated work best during a late-night headphones listen, while others beg to be blasted from car speakers; conceptually, the album begins at sundown and ends at dawn, but Jane Remover's latest will affect you in any setting.
